column1: Iglishmêk was a Dwarves language of silent gesture-signs.
*"I am listening" = slight raising of right-hand forefinger
column2: followed by a similar raising of the left-hand forefinger.

column1: *"Listen!" = slight raising of both forefingers simultaneously.
Magnus Åberg has theorized that the word iglishmêk is composed of *igal *"language" (as in aglâb) and *shimak *"gesture".
